definition: lit. to cover one's ears whilst stealing a bell/to deceive oneself/to bury one's head in the sand (idiom)

sentences.english: So I can make believe I have everything.
sentences.chinese: 縱然我可以掩耳盜鈴的以爲自己擁有了一切。

sentences.english: Ungrateful people are actually cheating themselves, scientists believe.
sentences.chinese: 科學家們以爲，不知感恩的人理論上是掩耳盜鈴。

sentences.english: You nosl do not stay; I for soon for more why a self-deception for soon for more.
sentences.chinese: 邇終究沒有一句挽留，我又何必再掩耳盜鈴。

definition: lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to whisper to one another's ear
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
to make a fool of oneself
